app.title: Lightroom Photo & Video Editor
app.description:
Adobe Lightroom — meet a smarter photo editor. Make any photo special with our easy, yet powerful picture editor. Lightroom is here to help you get shareworthy photos in seconds — to capture sunsets, family moments, or your latest foodie find. State of the art photo editor tools allow you to fix pictures, enhance photo quality, and edit videos.

Whether you’re curating a social feed or snapping a photograph — access editing tools in your pocket with this photo editor. Lightroom is here to help you create photos you’re proud to share. 

WHY YOU SHOULD TRY LIGHTROOM:

EASILY MAKE YOUR PHOTOS LOOK AMAZING WITH OUR PHOTO EDITOR 
- Picture editor: In a few taps, make a photograph brighter, soften a background, or touch out blemishes. 
- One-tap features: Quick Actions and Adaptive Presets let you enhance photo quality in seconds. 
- Presets for photos: Discover filters or make your own signature look. 
- Video Editing: Bring the same creative energy to your clips with tools for light, color, and presets.

REMOVE DISTRACTIONS AND BLUR THE BACKGROUND
- Picture editor tools that give professional results. 
- Blur the photo background for a polished look, adjust the finer details, or use Generative Remove to remove objects and erase people from a photo.

STATE OF THE ART PHOTO EDITOR
- Take control of light with tools to tweak exposure, highlights, and shadows. 
- Play with presets, HD photo effects, color grading, hue, saturation and add a blur or bokeh effect. 
- AI photo editor: These tools suggest the best edits for your images. Perfect for quick fixes or adding your unique style to an HD photo, no experience required.

FIND COMMUNITY INSPIRATION 
- Browse photo filters and presets shared by photo enthusiasts around the world. 
- Match your aesthetic with inspiration from the community: Whether they’re bold edits with an AI photo editor or subtle tweaks for a polished portrait edit, find a look that matches your style — or create your own. 

EDIT ONCE, APPLY IT TO MULTIPLE PHOTOS
- Photo editing that is quick, easy, and effortless.
- Batch edit photos: Create consistent editing across a group of photos when you copy and paste your edits across multiple photos.
- Save your favorites and make every photo feel like you. 

Download Lightroom today. 

Terms & Conditions:  

Your use of this application is governed by the Adobe General Terms of Use http://www.adobe.com/go/terms_en and the Adobe Privacy Policy http://www.adobe.com/go/privacy_policy_en

Do not sell or share my personal information www.adobe.com/go/ca-rights

app.summary: Quick Actions instantly suggests edits that easily get you better photos.

reviews.text: the ease of doing quick edits of pics that you took on the phone without having to go through the transfer hassle to a PC is amazing. but not having every feature from the desktop application is the loss. it's a mobile app, but sometimes the ones that are missing is sometimes the most powerful tools we tend to look for and use regularly that exists in the desktop app

The app is amazing! Great for making beautiful edits and it's very easy to use as well. I recommend watching a tutorial because that helped me get a grasp of it. I dont like that the best features are for pro and some of the effects you can only get a few of because the others are all included with pro. I wish more was free. And for some reason after three days of use, nothing will load none of my photos or anything. I don't know why. I tried multiple things and nothing worked. Great overall!

Honestly, this one of the best photo editing apps I've ever come across. Really taught me a lot on the technical stuff, and although there are some features that are only available via monthly payments (which is only about $5 per month and I'd gladly pay), it's still a really amazing app without them. A must for if you want to edit each specific parts of a photo better and wow anyone. It can also act as a stepping stone towards the CC desktop version, which is more complicated.

4/14/24 Edit... the frequent crashing seems to have subsided and things this far are much more stable. Had 5 stars but something changed recently (within past week) and the app constantly crashes, many times before you can even get a quick edit and save in. I'll probably cancel my premium that I just recently started as I can't even use the basic features. Hopefully it'll be fixed soon and back to 5 star quality.
reviews.replyText: Hello! We apologize for the inconvenience you encountered. Our team is aware of the issue and is actively working on a solution. Thank you for your feedback and patience while we enhance the app.

reviews.text: This is my go to app for editing! I love the convenience of how simple the app is to navigate and the range of possibilities with editing that you can do. However, the new update has made the generative remove tool not work properly. I mainly photograph children, so there is always something to remove in the background of the pictures from me having to chase them around. Please try to get this fixed as soon as possible. Thank you!

Overall I really love this program. The functionality on mobile devices is pretty good. Comparable to the desktop program. My only complaint is that the remove or heal feature doesn't work great on larger items items (in relation to the whole photo). I've mostly used the mobile app so this is more focused on that, but I have had similar issues in the desktop app as well.

I love and hate it. I love the functions on this app and that there is a free version. I think it is absolutely ridiculous that if you delete the app or update it, you lose all of your photos AND presets if you are not on a paid subscription. All of my time is completely wasted and all my presets and edits gone forever. I don't understand why an app that is so important to people's photography jobs would allow something like this to happen so easily. Please fix this issue Lightroom.
reviews.replyText: Hi, Sorry you've had a bad experience. Unfortunately, with a free account your images and presets aren't synced so they may be lost. You might recover your images if you have a backup of your phone. Your presets may be recovered if you contact the place where you got them from. For more help let us know at: adobe.ly/lrmcommunity - /rs

reviews.text: I love Lightroom. It is hands down the best photo editing software available. Although the mobile version lacks in some aspects when compared to the desktop version, it still gets the job done. It is great for quick edits on the run. The mobile version is easy to learn and navigate. Just poking around for a while will teach you about so many aspects of editing if you do not have much prior experience.

I love lightroom for editing my photos on the go! My only issues with lightroom mobile are I'm still having issues with crashing in the middle of editing. This may have something to do with the file size of my photos, I'm not sure? Also I'd love to have an option to change the background from black to white. As I find the black background makes editing my photos more dull than I'd like them to be.
reviews.replyText: Hi! We apologise for the frustration you've experienced; we recommend trying the following steps: 1. Make sure to close all the running apps from the background. 2. Clear the app's cache and data from your device settings. 3. Restart your device and try again. If the issue persists, please let us know on forums.adobe.com. ^Rc

reviews.text: Unusable! A poorly optimised app. This app struggles to open on my device! It is storing over 7GB of cache for basic photo editing. Each editing feature takes 2 minutes to load, when I finally finish editing my images will not download to my device. I feel scammed and I will be cancelling my subscription immediately.
reviews.replyText: Hi, sorry you're having trouble. We would like to hear more about what's going on. Please mail us at LrAndroid-Feedback@adobe.com and we will do what we can to figure it out. Please include screenshots and the specific steps to recreate your issue. ^RC

app.developerLegalAddress: 345 Park Ave, San Jose, CA 95110, United States
app.recentChanges:
- Get creative assistance in Quick Actions to enhance parts of an outdoor scene, like the sky, water, or plants
- Instantly detect & remove extra people with Generative Remove
- Give or like comments in privately shared albums
- New camera & lens support (adobe.com/go/cameras)
- Bug fixes, stability & performance improvements
app.AIReview:
Lightroom Photo & Video Editor Review – A Powerful Tool with Room to Grow

Overview

Adobe Lightroom remains a dominant force in the mobile photo editing landscape, boasting over 402 million installs and a robust 4.58-star rating from 3.23 million users. This free application offers a surprisingly deep toolkit for both photographers and casual users alike, aiming to transform everyday snapshots into shareable masterpieces. The app’s core functionality revolves around intelligent editing suggestions through “Quick Actions,” alongside traditional manual controls for fine-tuning images and videos. While the free version provides substantial capabilities, it's important to understand its limitations compared to the paid Lightroom subscription model. The focus here is on assessing whether Lightroom’s strengths outweigh its shortcomings in a competitive market.

Key Features

Lightroom’s feature set is broad, catering to a wide range of editing needs:

  • Quick Actions: This is arguably the app's most significant differentiator. Based on AI analysis, Quick Actions automatically suggest adjustments like “Pop,” “Warmth,” “Sharpen,” and “Vibrant” – often dramatically improving an image within seconds. For example, applying "Pop" to a portrait photo consistently brightens skin tones and adds a pleasing vibrancy.
  • Presets: Users can apply pre-designed editing styles (presets) created by Adobe or community members, allowing for rapid stylistic transformations. The sheer volume of available presets is considerable.
  • Detailed Editing Controls: Beyond Quick Actions, Lightroom offers granular control over exposure, contrast, highlights, shadows, whites, blacks, clarity, texture, vibrance, and saturation. Users can adjust these sliders individually or use the curve editor for advanced tonal adjustments.
  • Selective Adjustments: The masking tool allows users to target specific areas of an image for localized editing – ideal for things like brightening a subject's face without affecting the background.
  • Video Editing: Lightroom now includes basic video editing capabilities, allowing users to trim footage, add music, and apply filters directly within the app. While not as robust as dedicated video editors, it provides convenient edits for social media content.
  • RAW Support: Lightroom supports RAW image formats, preserving maximum detail and color information captured by compatible cameras.
  • Cloud Syncing: Photos edited in Lightroom Mobile sync seamlessly to Adobe Creative Cloud’s desktop version of Lightroom, allowing users to continue their workflow across devices.

Strengths

  • Intuitive Quick Actions: The Quick Actions feature genuinely streamlines the editing process, particularly for less experienced users. It consistently produces visually appealing results with minimal effort. This is a major reason for the app's popularity.
  • Powerful Manual Controls: Despite the ease of use offered by Quick Actions, Lightroom doesn’t sacrifice depth. The manual controls are precisely tuned and offer exceptional control over image quality, catering to more experienced editors.
  • Cross-Platform Syncing: The seamless integration with Adobe Creative Cloud is a significant advantage for users who work across multiple devices. Editing on your phone and finishing on your desktop is remarkably fluid.
  • Excellent Color Grading Tools: Lightroom has consistently been praised for its color grading abilities, offering precise control over hue, saturation, and luminance adjustments.

Areas for Improvement

  • Preset Management: While the sheer number of presets is a strength, it also creates clutter. A more robust organizational system within presets – perhaps tagging or folders – would significantly improve usability.
  • Video Editing Limitations: The video editing features are currently quite basic. Advanced options like multi-track editing or color grading aren’t available, limiting its appeal for serious videographers.
  • Masking Tool Refinement: While the masking tool is effective, it could benefit from more precise control options and a smoother brush interface. Currently, achieving truly seamless selections can be challenging.
  • Performance on Older Devices: Some users have reported performance issues (lag) on older Android or iOS devices. Optimizations for lower-end hardware would improve the user experience.

User Experience

The Lightroom Mobile app benefits from a clean and modern interface. The layout is logically organized, with editing tools easily accessible through intuitive tabs. The Quick Actions are prominently displayed, encouraging experimentation. The learning curve is relatively gentle, thanks to the guided tutorials and helpful tooltips. However, mastering the more advanced features – particularly masking and curve adjustments – requires some practice. The app’s responsiveness is generally good, but as noted earlier, performance can degrade on older devices.

Value for Money

Lightroom is offered entirely free of charge, a significant draw for casual users. This access allows users to explore the full breadth of the app's capabilities before considering a subscription to Lightroom Creative Cloud, which unlocks advanced features like cloud storage, collaboration tools and more extensive video editing options. The value proposition is strongest for those who regularly edit photos or videos and find themselves needing the power and flexibility offered by Lightroom’s premium features.

Conclusion

Lightroom Photo & Video Editor remains one of the best photo editing apps available on mobile devices. Its intuitive Quick Actions, powerful manual controls, and seamless cross-platform syncing make it a compelling choice for photographers and casual users alike. While areas for improvement exist – particularly around video editing and preset management – the app’s strengths overwhelmingly outweigh its weaknesses. The free version offers substantial value, making it an excellent starting point for anyone looking to elevate their mobile photo editing game. Considering the high number of installs (402 million+), Adobe has clearly created a product that resonates with a massive audience, and for good reason.
